title: Provides for quarantines and declaration of state of emergency in certain instances of disease affecting domestic animals
summary: Provides for quarantines and declaration of state of emergency in certain instances of disease affecting domestic animals; provides for the establishment of a animal disease control fund.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. ORTIZ, MAYERSOHN, NOLAN, PERRY, TOWNS -- read
         once and referred to the Committee on Agriculture

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation  to  animal
         diseases, quarantines and garbage restrictions; to amend the executive
         law,  in  relation  to  state  of disaster emergency; and to amend the
         state finance law, in relation to creating the animal disease  control
         fund

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The agriculture and markets law is amended by adding a  new
    2  section 72-b to read as follows:
    3    S  72-B.   REGISTRATION AS GARBAGE FEEDING OPERATOR; FEES; CERTIFICATE
    4  OF REGISTRATION, EXPIRATION AND REVOCATION; DISPOSITION  OF  MONEYS.  1.
    5  EXCEPT  AS  OTHERWISE  PROVIDED IN LAW, ANY PERSON, FIRM, PARTNERSHIP OR
    6  CORPORATION SHALL BE ALLOWED TO REGISTER AS A GARBAGE FEEDING OPERATOR.
    7    2. IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL FOR ANY PERSON, FIRM,  PARTNERSHIP  OR  CORPO-
    8  RATION  TO FEED COOKED GARBAGE TO ANIMALS, OTHER THAN DOGS, AS PERMITTED
    9  IN THIS CHAPTER, UNLESS THE OPERATOR OF SUCH GARBAGE FEEDING  ESTABLISH-
   10  MENT  SHALL HAVE FIRST REGISTERED AS A GARBAGE FEEDING OPERATOR WITH THE
   11  COMMISSIONER AND SHALL HAVE PAID THE ANNUAL REGISTRATION FEE UNDER  THIS
   12  SECTION FOR EACH PLACE WHERE GARBAGE IS TO BE FED.
   13    3. THE COMMISSIONER MAY ACCEPT APPLICATIONS FOR REGISTRATION ON A FORM
   14  TO BE SUPPLIED BY THE COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE. UPON THE ACCEPTANCE OF SUCH
   15  APPLICATION  FOR REGISTRATION AND THE RECEIPT OF THE ANNUAL REGISTRATION
   16  FEE UNDER THIS SECTION FOR EACH PLACE WHERE GARBAGE IS TO  BE  FED,  THE
   17  COMMISSIONER SHALL ISSUE TO SUCH APPLICANT AND OPERATOR A CERTIFICATE OF
   18  REGISTRATION  FOR  THE  CURRENT OPERATION PERIOD. SUCH CERTIFICATE SHALL
   19  EXPIRE ON JUNE THIRTIETH EACH YEAR FOLLOWING THE DATE OF ISSUANCE OF THE
   20  CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION. THE APPLICATION  FOR  REGISTRATION  MAY  BE
   21  REJECTED AND DENIED IF THE APPLICANT DOES NOT SUPPLY ALL THE INFORMATION

    1  DEEMED  ESSENTIAL  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER  AND IF THE APPLICANT'S GARBAGE
    2  FEEDING ESTABLISHMENT DOES NOT MEET THE REQUIREMENTS  OF  THIS  CHAPTER,
    3  AND THE RULES AND REGULATIONS ADOPTED THEREUNDER.
    4    4.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  FIX  THE ANNUAL REGISTRATION FEE IN SUCH
    5  AMOUNT AS THE  COMMISSIONER  DEEMS  DESIRABLE  IN  INTERESTS  OF  PUBLIC
    6  SERVICE, BUT NOT IN AN AMOUNT OF MORE THAN FIFTEEN DOLLARS PER REGISTRA-
    7  TION FOR EACH GARBAGE FEEDING ESTABLISHMENT.
    8    5.  THE  CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION FOR GARBAGE FEEDING OPERATORS MAY
    9  BE REVOKED BY THE COMMISSIONER WHENEVER THE OPERATOR OF A GARBAGE  FEED-
   10  ING ESTABLISHMENT IS FOUND TO BE OPERATING IN VIOLATION OF LAW, OR RULES
   11  AND REGULATIONS ADOPTED THEREUNDER, OR IN AN UNSANITARY MANNER. ANY SUCH
   12  OPERATOR  SHALL  FIRST  BE GIVEN NOTICE OF HEARING AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO
   13  APPEAR AND BE HEARD IN DEFENSE OF ANY PROCEEDING FOR THE  REVOCATION  OF
   14  ANY CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE
   15  STATE ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURE ACT.
   16    6.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  REMIT  ALL MONEYS RECEIVED BY OR FOR THE
   17  COMMISSIONER UNDER THIS ARTICLE TO THE  COMPTROLLER  AT  LEAST  MONTHLY.
   18  UPON  RECEIPT  OF ANY SUCH REMITTANCE, THE COMPTROLLER SHALL DEPOSIT THE
   19  ENTIRE AMOUNT THEREOF IN THE STATE TREASURY AND THE SAME SHALL BE  CRED-
   20  ITED  TO THE ANIMAL DISEASE CONTROL FUND ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION
   21  NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   22    S 2. Section 76 of the agriculture and  markets  law,  is  amended  by
   23  adding  five  new  subdivisions  1-a,  1-b,  1-c, 1-d and 1-e to read as
   24  follows:
   25    1-A. WHEN THE COMMISSIONER DETERMINES  THAT  A  QUARANTINE  AND  OTHER
   26  REGULATIONS  ARE  NECESSARY TO PREVENT THE SPREAD AMONG DOMESTIC ANIMALS
   27  OF ANY CONTAGIOUS OR INFECTIOUS DISEASE, THE COMMISSIONER  SHALL  NOTIFY
   28  THE  GOVERNOR  OF  SUCH  DETERMINATION,  AND THE GOVERNOR SHALL ISSUE AN
   29  EXECUTIVE ORDER ANNOUNCING THE  BOUNDARY  OF  SUCH  QUARANTINE  AND  THE
   30  ORDERS  AND RULES AND REGULATIONS PRESCRIBED BY THE COMMISSIONER, EXCEPT
   31  THAT THE COMMISSIONER, IF THE AREA AFFECTED BY QUARANTINE IS LIMITED  IN
   32  EXTENT,  MAY  DISPENSE WITH THE EXECUTIVE ORDER OF THE GOVERNOR AND GIVE
   33  SUCH NOTICE AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL DEEM SUFFICIENT TO MAKE THE  QUAR-
   34  ANTINE EFFECTIVE.
   35    1-B.  UPON  A DETERMINATION BY THE GOVERNOR THAT A QUARANTINE OR OTHER
   36  REGULATIONS ARE NECESSARY TO PREVENT THE SPREAD AMONG  DOMESTIC  ANIMALS
   37  OF  ANY  CONTAGIOUS OR INFECTIOUS DISEASE, THE GOVERNOR SHALL DIRECT THE
   38  COMMISSIONER TO ESTABLISH A QUARANTINE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   39    1-C. THE GOVERNOR MAY REQUIRE AND DIRECT THE COOPERATION  AND  ASSIST-
   40  ANCE  OF  ANY  STATE  AGENCY IN ENFORCING SUCH QUARANTINE OR OTHER REGU-
   41  LATIONS PRESCRIBED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISIONS  ONE-A  AND  ONE-B  OF  THIS
   42  SECTION.
   43    1-D.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ESTABLISH SUCH QUARANTINE IMMEDIATELY AND
   44  SHALL GIVE AND ENFORCE SUCH DIRECTIONS,  RULES  AND  REGULATIONS  AS  TO
   45  SEPARATING,  ISOLATING,  HANDLING  AND  TREATING, FEEDING AND CARING FOR
   46  SUCH DISEASED ANIMALS, ANIMALS EXPOSED TO THE DISEASE AND ANIMALS WITHIN
   47  THE QUARANTINE WHICH HAVE NOT BEEN IMMEDIATELY EXPOSED, AS  THE  COMMIS-
   48  SIONER  DEEMS  NECESSARY TO PREVENT THOSE CLASSES OF ANIMALS FROM COMING
   49  INTO CONTACT WITH ONE ANOTHER.
   50    1-E. THE COMMISSIONER  OR  HIS  OR  HER  DESIGNEE  IS  AUTHORIZED  AND
   51  EMPOWERED  TO ENTER ANY GROUNDS AND PREMISES TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS
   52  OF THIS SECTION.
   53    S 3. Section 85 of the agriculture and markets law is amended to  read
   54  as follows:
   55    S 85. Destruction  of  animals;  disposition  of  carcasses.    1. The
   56  commissioner may prescribe rules for the destruction of animals affected

       A. 1024                             3

    1  with infectious or communicable disease, and for the proper disposal  of
    2  their hides and carcasses and all objects which might carry infection or
    3  contagion.  Whenever  in  his judgment necessary for the more speedy and
    4  economical  suppression  or prevention of the spread of any such disease
    5  he may cause to be slaughtered and afterward disposed of, in such manner
    6  as he may deem expedient, any animal or  animals  which  by  contact  or
    7  association  with  diseased  animals  or  other exposure to infection or
    8  contagion may be considered or suspected to be  liable  to  contract  or
    9  communicate  the  disease  sought  to  be suppressed or prevented.   The
   10  commissioner may seize and cause  to  be  destroyed  a  carcass  or  any
   11  portion thereof affected with any communicable disease.
   12    2.  (A) THE OPERATOR OF A LICENSED DISPOSAL PLANT SHALL DISPOSE OF THE
   13  CARCASSES OF DOMESTIC ANIMALS OR PACKINGHOUSE REFUSE BY  COMPLYING  WITH
   14  THE FOLLOWING STANDARDS AND REQUIREMENTS:
   15    (I)  THE  SKINNING  AND  DISMEMBERING OF CARCASSES OF DOMESTIC ANIMALS
   16  SHALL BE PERFORMED WITHIN THE BUILDING WHERE  THE  CARCASSES  ARE  PROC-
   17  ESSED;
   18    (II) THE COOKING VATS OR TANKS SHALL BE AIRTIGHT, EXCEPT PROPER ESCAPE
   19  FOR LIVE STEAM;
   20    (III) STEAM SHALL BE SO DISPOSED OF AS NOT TO BE DETRIMENTAL TO PUBLIC
   21  HEALTH OR SAFETY;
   22    (IV)  THE  MATERIALS NOT COOKED OR ENTIRELY CONSUMED BY BURNING WITHIN
   23  THE PLANT SHALL BE DISPOSED OF:
   24    (A) BY BURYING TO SUCH A DEPTH THAT NO PART OF SUCH CARCASS  SHALL  BE
   25  NEARER  THAN  THREE  FEET  TO  THE  SURFACE  OF THE GROUND, AND SHALL BE
   26  COVERED WITH QUICK-LIME AND WITH AT LEAST THREE FEET OF EARTH; OR
   27    (B) IN SUCH MANNER AS MAY  BE  PRESCRIBED  BY  RULES  AND  REGULATIONS
   28  ADOPTED BY THE COMMISSIONER;
   29    (V)  ALL CARCASSES OF DOMESTIC ANIMALS OR PACKINGHOUSE REFUSE SHALL BE
   30  DISPOSED OF WITHIN FORTY-EIGHT HOURS  AFTER  DELIVERY  TO  THE  DISPOSAL
   31  PLANT;
   32    (VI) ALL CARCASSES, PARTS THEREOF, OR REFUSE UNDER PROCESS FOR MARKET-
   33  ING  SHALL  NOT  BE  PERMITTED  TO  COME IN CONTACT WITH ANY PART OF THE
   34  BUILDING OR EQUIPMENT USED IN CONNECTION WITH THE  UNLOADING,  SKINNING,
   35  DISMEMBERING  AND GRINDING OF CARCASSES OR REFUSE AS ORIGINALLY RECEIVED
   36  AT THE DISPOSAL PLANT; AND
   37    (VII) THE COOKING OF MATERIALS SHALL BE AT A TEMPERATURE OF 212µF  FOR
   38  A PERIOD OF THIRTY MINUTES.
   39    (B)  THE COMMISSIONER MAY ISSUE A RELEASE FOR PORTIONS OF CARCASSES OF
   40  DEAD ANIMALS WHICH ARE UNCOOKED, OR WHICH ARE COOKED FOR A PERIOD SHORT-
   41  ER THAN THIRTY MINUTES OR AT A TEMPERATURE LESS  THAN  212µF,  OR  BOTH.
   42  SUCH  RELEASE REQUIRES THAT THE PRODUCTS SO RELEASED SHALL BE IDENTIFIED
   43  BY FREELY SLASHING AND COVERING ALL EXPOSED SURFACES  OF  SUCH  PRODUCTS
   44  WITH  AN EDIBLE GREEN DYE OR OTHER SUITABLE SUBSTANCE AS MAY BE APPROVED
   45  BY THE COMMISSIONER. SUCH PRODUCTS SHALL OTHERWISE MEET THE REQUIREMENTS
   46  OF THIS CHAPTER.
   47    S 4. The agriculture and markets  law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
   48  section 85-a to read as follows:
   49    S  85-A.  UNLAWFUL TO CONTRACT FOR DISPOSAL OF UNPROCESSED GARBAGE. 1.
   50  IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL FOR THE GOVERNING BODY OF ANY CITY, OR ANY OFFICIAL
   51  OR EMPLOYEE OF A CITY, TO ENTER INTO ANY CONTRACT OR AGREEMENT  FOR  THE
   52  COLLECTION  OR  DISPOSAL  OF  GARBAGE  UNLESS SUCH CONTRACT OR AGREEMENT
   53  REQUIRES DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE IN ACCORDANCE WITH  RULES  AND  REGULATIONS
   54  PROMULGATED BY THE COMMISSIONER, WHEN DISPOSED OF BY OTHER MEANS.

       A. 1024                             4

    1    2.  IT  SHALL  BE  UNLAWFUL  FOR  ANY PERSON TO GIVE, SELL OR TRANSFER
    2  GARBAGE TO ANOTHER PERSON, IF SUCH PERSON KNOWS THAT SUCH  OTHER  PERSON
    3  IS COMMERCIALLY FEEDING THE GARBAGE TO A CLOVEN HOOFED ANIMAL.
    4    S  5.  Section  90-b  of the agriculture and markets law is amended by
    5  adding four new subdivisions 24, 25, 26 and 27 to read as follows:
    6    24. THE TERM "DISPOSAL PLANT" MEANS A PLACE OF BUSINESS OR A  LOCATION
    7  WHERE  THE  CARCASSES  OF  DOMESTIC  ANIMALS  OR  PACKINGHOUSE REFUSE IS
    8  PURCHASED, RECEIVED OR UNLOADED WHERE SUCH CARCASSES OR REFUSE ARE PROC-
    9  ESSED FOR THE PURPOSE OF OBTAINING HIDE, SKIN, GREASE, RESIDUE,  OR  ANY
   10  OTHER BYPRODUCT FROM THE ANIMAL OR REFUSE, IN ANY WAY WHATSOEVER.
   11    25.  THE TERM "SUBSTATION" MEANS A CONCENTRATION SITE EQUIPPED WITH AT
   12  LEAST ONE STORAGE BUILDING AND OPERATED AND MAINTAINED FOR THE TEMPORARY
   13  DEPOSIT OR STORAGE OF THE CARCASSES OF DOMESTIC  ANIMALS  PENDING  FINAL
   14  DELIVERY OF THE CARCASSES TO THE DISPOSAL PLANT.
   15    26.  THE  TERM  "PLACE OF TRANSFER" MEANS A RELOADING SITE, AUTHORIZED
   16  FOR USE IN DIRECT TRANSFERRING OF CARCASSES  OF  DOMESTIC  ANIMALS  FROM
   17  VEHICLES  MAKING  ORIGINAL  PICKUP  OR LOADING TO A LINE VEHICLE FOR THE
   18  TRANSPORTATION OF THE CARCASSES TO THE DISPOSAL PLANT.
   19    27. THE TERM "CARCASSES OF DOMESTIC ANIMALS" MEANS BODIES, OR ANY PART
   20  OR PORTION THEREOF, OF DEAD DOMESTIC ANIMALS NOT SLAUGHTERED  FOR  HUMAN
   21  FOOD.
   22    S  6. Paragraph a of subdivision 2 of section 20 of the executive law,
   23  as amended by section 1 of part B of chapter 56 of the laws of 2010,  is
   24  amended to read as follows:
   25    a.  "disaster"  means  occurrence or imminent threat of wide spread or
   26  severe damage, injury, or loss of life or property  resulting  from  any
   27  natural  or man-made causes, including, but not limited to, fire, flood,
   28  earthquake, hurricane, tornado, high water, landslide,  mudslide,  wind,
   29  storm,  wave  action,  volcanic activity, epidemic, CONTAGIOUS OR INFEC-
   30  TIOUS  DISEASE,  air  contamination,  terrorism,  cyber  event,  blight,
   31  drought,  infestation, explosion, radiological accident, nuclear, chemi-
   32  cal, biological, or bacteriological release, water contamination, bridge
   33  failure or bridge collapse.
   34    S 7. Section 28 of the executive law is amended by adding a new subdi-
   35  vision 2-a to read as follows:
   36    2-A. IN ADDITION TO THE OTHER POWERS AUTHORIZED BY THIS  ARTICLE,  THE
   37  GOVERNOR,  UPON FINDING THAT A DISASTER HAS OCCURRED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE
   38  FIVE OF THE AGRICULTURE AND MARKETS LAW, AND THAT A QUARANTINE OR  OTHER
   39  REGULATIONS  ARE  NECESSARY TO PREVENT THE SPREAD AMONG DOMESTIC ANIMALS
   40  OF ANY CONTAGIOUS OR INFECTIOUS DISEASE, MAY ISSUE  AN  EXECUTIVE  ORDER
   41  DECLARING  A STATE OF EMERGENCY. IF THE GOVERNOR SHALL ISSUE SUCH EXECU-
   42  TIVE ORDER DECLARING A STATE OF EMERGENCY, THE  ORDER  SHALL  REMAIN  IN
   43  EFFECT FOR A PERIOD OF FIFTEEN DAYS BUT NOT TO EXCEED SIX MONTHS, UNLESS
   44  OTHERWISE RESCINDED BY THE GOVERNOR.
   45    S  8. The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 99-t to
   46  read as follows:
   47    S 99-T. ANIMAL DISEASE CONTROL FUND. 1. THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED IN
   48  THE JOINT CUSTODY OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER AND THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXA-
   49  TION AND FINANCE A FUND TO BE  KNOWN  AS  THE  "ANIMAL  DISEASE  CONTROL
   50  FUND".
   51    2.  SUCH FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL MONEYS COLLECTED PURSUANT TO SUBDI-
   52  VISION SIX OF SECTION SEVENTY-TWO-B OF THE AGRICULTURE AND MARKETS  LAW,
   53  AND ALL OTHER MONEYS CREDITED OR TRANSFERRED THERETO FROM ANY OTHER FUND
   54  OR SOURCE PURSUANT TO LAW.
   55    3.  MONEYS  OF THE FUND SHALL BE EXPENDED FOR THE PURPOSES OF CARRYING
   56  OUT THE PROVISIONS OF  SECTION  SEVENTY-TWO-B  OF  THE  AGRICULTURE  AND

       A. 1024                             5

    1  MARKETS  LAW.  MONEYS  SHALL  BE  PAID  OUT OF THE FUND ON THE AUDIT AND
    2  WARRANT OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER ON VOUCHERS APPROVED BY THE COMMISSION-
    3  ER OF AGRICULTURE AND MARKETS. ANY INTEREST RECEIVED BY THE  COMPTROLLER
    4  ON  MONEYS  ON  DEPOSIT  IN  THE  ANIMAL  DISEASE  CONTROL FUND SHALL BE
    5  RETAINED IN AND BECOME PART OF SUCH FUND.
    6    S 9. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
    7  it shall have become a law.
